alert.note: Alert for Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 11:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Pike. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain had diminished across the area; however, excessive runoff previous heavy rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding of creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pikeville, Zebulon, Piso, Jarad and Heenan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
